position: Process Analytics and Engineering Intern (BS/MS candidates)
description:
At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

Main Goal of this summer project is to develop strategy for cloud computing of equipment monitoring processes using existing options available within BMS. Some additional work on side projects revolving around but not limited to the equipment robustness program, including equipment monitoring, automated email service, and maximizing utilization of a shared computer.

Key Responsibilities

  • Defining plan, risk assessment, and strategy for cloud computing of equipment monitoring processes
  • Maximize utilization of shared computer
  • Fully automated Equipment Robustness monitoring plan method that will decrease the number of FTE hours for monitoring equipment.
  • Expanded automated email service for new sites and equipment.

Qualifications & Experience

  • All candidates must be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship needs.
  • Candidates must be a rising junior, senior or master’s student currently enrolled in an accredited college/university seeking an undergraduate degree or master’s degree in engineering (chemical preferred) and continuing their education for the following semester (e.g., Fall 2021).
  • Minor in Computer Science or strong Computer Skills
  • Strong computer programing experience in MATlab, Python, R, C++, HTML, Java, etc.
  • Highly motivated, self-driven individual with the ability to work in a project team structure.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience with video conferencing, MS Teams, Zoom, etc.
  • Must be eligible to work full-time remotely, 40 hours per week, from June – August 2021.

BMSEC, BMSINTERN
